intro: Corunastylis trifida, commonly known as the three-lobed burrplant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, three-lobed bracts that enclose the flowers. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Corunastylis trifida is typically found in sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
